incidents.name: Zone server change propagation is delayed

incident_updates.body: We have confirmed zone propagation is operating normally. This issue is now closed.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: Zone server propagation should be returning to normal. We will continue to monitor it and resolve the issue once we are confident that the system is behaving as expected.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We have identified an issue that is causing zone server propagation delays to our AMS region. We are currently working on resolving this issue and returning zone propagation to its normal speed. DNS resolution is not affected.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incidents.name: DNS and Zone Server firmware upgrades in Ashburn and Amsterdam regions

incident_updates.body: We're fully back to operational across the board. As always, email support if you have any questions or concerns.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We're still hard at work here. Ashburn upgrades have been completed and the region is beginning to respond to requests and receive updates. Doing some manual verification now to make sure everything is good.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We've completed the work in Amsterdam which took longer than expected, but they are all online and responding to queries. Ashburn is last but not least and we'll be working on that region next. For this region we will be taking it out of the global routing pool to avoid delaying zone changes for customers. The result is that zone updates will go out as normal, but resolution may be slower in some regions since Ashburn won't be around to respond to queries on the east coast of the US and Canada.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: Zone updates in Amsterdam are now restored. Once we complete the name server restarts in Amsterdam we'll move on to Ashburn to complete the maintenance window. Thanks once again for your patience.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We're hard at work on the Amsterdam region and getting close to restoring full service and zone updates.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We're beginning to prepare Amsterdam for the upgrades now. Zone updates will be delayed to that region until we can complete the first portion of upgrades to the systems and bring them back online.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: Maintenance will begin as scheduled in 60 minutes.

We're going to complete the BIOS firmware upgrades that were started yesterday in the remaining Ashburn and Amsterdam regions. Each region will experience a short delay in zone changes, but DNS service will still be working normally.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incidents.name: DNS and Zone Server firmware upgrades in all regions

incident_updates.body: Since this has taken longer than expected, we're going to create another scheduled maintenance window to cover the remaining Amsterdam and Ashburn data centers later today. This will give the teams (ours and our hosting provider) some time to rest so we can tackle the rest of the upgrades tomorrow. Thanks once again for your patience and as always, welcome to email support@dnsimple.com with any questions.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We're still working on Tokyo, but zone changes should begin propagating once again to the Tokyo region.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We have completed work in San Jose and now moving on to Tokyo next. Zone changes to Tokyo will be delayed until we complete part of the upgrade process. Thank you again for your patience as we work through each region.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: The firmware upgrades are still in progress for San Jose, but we have restored zone updates and Secondary DNS for that region. Once the final upgrades are complete we'll be working on Tokyo next.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We're now working on the San Jose region. Zone updates will be delayed along with Secondary DNS changes for only a few minutes as we roll out upgrades to the systems in this region. We're also better prepared for any firmware upgrade issues so these should not take as long and have as much of an impact on our service.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: The Chicago region is back online and receiving zone changes and responding to DNS queries. We'll be moving on to San Jose next which will cause a short outage of zone updates and secondary name server updates.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: The upgrades in Chicago have been completed and we are working on bringing that region back online and restoring service to that region. Thank you again for your patience as this was an unexpected, but now corrected issue with the upgrade process.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: Due to Chicago taking longer than expected to upgrade, we're going to temporarily re-route DNS traffic away from the Chicago data center due to the delays in zone updates to Chicago. We're aware the delay is impacting some customers and doing our best to correct the issue.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We're still waiting on the Chicago server upgrade to complete as it is taking longer than expect. We will keep you updated on when it is finished and zone updates have gone out to that region.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We're beginning maintenance in Chicago first. Zone updates to Chicago will be delayed as we begin rolling out upgrades.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We've finally tracked down a tricky issue with the memory on our name server systems that requires us to upgrade the BIOS to a newer version to resolve. This will require taking our name server and zone server systems temporarily offline in every region to perform the upgrades needed. During this maintenance window zone changes and updates will be delayed for each affected region for up to an hour at a time, but DNS service will be uninterrupted and work as expected. We're budgeting up to an hour for each region with a little extra to spare just in case.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We can confirm that this incident is fully resolved.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: All zone updates should be processing properly now. We will continue monitoring this before calling an all clear. Let us know if you experience any problems by emailing support @dnsimple.com.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We are seeing delayed zone updates. We will post more as we have further information.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We have received word from upstream that the issues we saw earlier are resolved and have verified this ourselves. Thank you for your patience. Please alert us if you continue to see any problems at support@dnsimple.com.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We are investigating some failures we're seeing in communicating with our upstream provider for registrar services. We'll pass on what we find out as we know more. DNS resolution and zone updates are unaffected.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incidents.name: Domain Registrar and SSL Certificate actions failing

incident_updates.body: It appears that our upstream provider for domain registration has now resolved the issues that were impacting them and domain registration and registration management should be back to normal. Thank you for your patience.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We are still seeing issues from our upstream provider, and are awaiting more details on issue and fixes that they are putting in place. As soon as we know more we will post updates on our status page.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We are still experiencing intermittent issues. Our provider is aware and it's working to find a solution as soon as possible. We'll keep updating this page as soon as we have more news.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: It appears the problem has been resolved, but we are monitoring the situation for any further failures.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We have noticed failures in all Registrar and Certificate related actions (domain registration, transfer, whois privacy, certificates purchases, etc) due to an upstream outage. We are working to determine the cause and expected resolution of the outage. DNS resolution is not affected.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: Zone changes should now be propagating in a timely fashion to our AMS data center. Thank you for your patience.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We have identified issues with DNS propagation in our AMS data center and are working to resolve this issue at the moment. DNS resolution of existing zone data is not affected.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: The scheduled maintenance has been completed.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: The DNSimple app and API are back and available for use. There may be some delays in zone deployment in the near term as we complete the maintenance process across. Thank you for your patience.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We are extending the maintenance window by 30 minutes as we wrap up last minute updates. We will do our best to get the application and API back up and fully operational before the window end. We are sorry for the inconvenience and will provide an update once the DNSimple site is available again.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: To clarify further, DNS will continue to respond and work as expected, but updates to DNS records will be delayed and our redirector service (URL records) will be intermittently available during the outage window. As always, you can email support with questions regarding this outage.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body:
We are going to deploy and upgrade several components in our database cluster that introduces better performance and higher availability in the production environment. Website and API access will be disabled and return HTTP 503 status codes until service is restored. 

Please contact support if you have any questions.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: Our sandbox maintenance window has been completed. Thanks for your patience.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: Scheduled maintenance is currently in progress. We will provide updates as necessary.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body:
We are going upgrade some components in our database cluster in our Sandbox environment. Website and API access will be disabled but the rest of our services will be unnafected.

Please contact support if you have any questions.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: Zone deployment should now be performing as expected.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.

incident_updates.body: We have identified an issue causing DNS update propagation delays. We are working to resolve that issue ASAP.

affected_components.name: No components were affected by this update.
